column1: Nicotine replacement therapy is a treatment to help people stop smoking.
These products do not contain many of the toxins found in smoke.
The goal of therapy is to cut down on cravings for nicotine and ease the symptoms of nicotine withdrawal.
- People who wear the patches for 24 hours will have fewer withdrawal symptoms.
- Most of the nicotine vapor does not go into the airways of the lung.
Some people have mouth or throat irritation and cough with the inhaler.
SIDE EFFECTS AND RISKS All nicotine products may cause side effects.
SPECIAL CONCERNS Nicotine patches are okay for use by most people with stable heart or blood circulation problems.
Keep all nicotine products away from children.
